intro: Thibaudia septemnervia, commonly known as the seven-veined thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a distinctive seven-veined pattern, giving it its scientific name. Thibaudia septemnervia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance.
